column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0286] The heat and mass balance was determined in the same manner as in Example C1 except for the above.
#Text=At this time, the permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of the CO.sub.2 separation membrane was varied, respectively, as shown in Table C2 to give Examples C5 to C8.
#Text=The results are shown in Table C2.
#Text=Example C9
#Text=[0287] The heat and mass balance was determined for a process with the configuration shown in FIG. 7.
#Text=This process includes a membrane separation reformer having the configuration as shown in FIG. 3, which is similar to Example C1.
#Text=[0288] The pre-reformer C2, which is packed with a Ru-based catalyst and performs a steam reforming reaction at an outlet temperature of 550.degree.
#Text=C. and pressure of 1 MPa, is fed with 215 kg/h of naphtha (line 200) and 946 kg/h of steam (not shown).
#Text=A partially reformed gas obtained from the pre-reformer joins a recycle line C206 and is then introduced into the reforming reaction tube 1b of the membrane separation reformer C1.
#Text=A nickel-based steam reforming catalyst, which is packed in the reforming reaction tube whose outlet temperature is set at 600.degree.
#Text=C., decomposes the carbon-containing fuel to produce hydrogen.

#Text=At the same time, a part of the produced hydrogen permeates the hydrogen-permeable membrane 1c constituting a part of the wall of the reforming reaction tube and consisting of a Pd-based alloy and flows through the space 1d to yield 34.5 kmol/h of high purity hydrogen having a purity of 99.99% (line C202).

#Text=[0289] As the off-gas of the membrane separation reformer (line C203), there is obtained a mixed gas having a total gas flow rate excluding steam of 23.8 kmol/h, a CO.sub.2 concentration of 49%, a CO concentration of 6%, and a hydrogen concentration of 36%.
#Text=This mixed gas further passes through the shift reactor C3 packed with a Cu--Zn catalyst and operated at an outlet temperature of 300.degree.
#Text=C. and is thereby converted into a mixed gas having a CO.sub.2 concentration of 52%, a CO concentration of 0.9%, and a hydrogen concentration of 39% (line C204).

#Text=The resulting mixed gas is dewatered with a dewaterer (not shown) and then introduced into the CO.sub.2 separation membrane C5 including a membrane having a CO.sub.2/hydrogen permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of 30.

#Text=The permeation side gas (line C205) of the CO.sub.2 separation membrane has a CO.sub.2 concentration of 93%, which is pressurized to about 8 MPa by the compressor C7 and then fed into the CO.sub.2 liquefier C6 from the line C209 to yield 9.5 kmol/h of a liquefied CO.sub.2 flow (line C210).

#Text=The non-permeation side gas (line C207) of the CO.sub.2 separation membrane is introduced, at a pressure as it is, into the hydrogen separation membrane C4 provided with a polyimide membrane having a CO.sub.2/hydrogen permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of 0.11.

#Text=On the permeation side of the hydrogen separation membrane, there is obtained 5.3 kmol/h of a gas (line C208) having a hydrogen concentration of 94% and a pressure of 0.1 MPa, which is recycled upstream of the membrane separation reformer C1 through the compressor C8 and the line C206.

#Text=On the other hand, the non-permeation side gas (line C211) of the hydrogen separation membrane and the off-gas of the CO.sub.2 liquefier (line C212) are combined to form a gas flow (line C213), which is sent to the reformer burner 1e, used as a fuel for combustion in the reformer, and then discharged (line C222).
